snippet: The moves come at a time when Chancellor Angela Merkel has pressed struggling European partners to slash public spending.
abstract: Leaders from German Chancellor Angela Merkel's coalition agree on raft of changes to social welfare programs aimed at easing costs for average Germans, to bolster government's sagging popularity less than year before parliamentary elections; measures come at time when Merkel has been pressing Germany's struggling European partners to slash public spending, underscoring uneven economic outlook across continent.
lead_paragraph: The moves come at a time when Chancellor Angela Merkel has pressed struggling European partners to slash public spending.

headline.seo: Changes Approved to Ease Germans’ Costs for Welfare Programs
headline.main: Changes Are Approved to Ease Germans’ Costs for Welfare Programs
headline.print_headline: Changes Are Approved To Ease Germans’ Costs For Welfare Programs
